metadata.title: Diatom Assemblages from the Pliocene-Pleistocene Boundary Beds in Kamchatka, Russia

creators.name: Russian Academy of Science, Institute of Lithosphere, Staromonetny per. 22, Moscow

metadata.description:
The identification of North Pacific diatom assemblages in the Olkhovian
     Formation of eastern Kamchatka and their correlation with the paleomagnetic
     time scale allows accurate placement of the Pliocene-Pleistocene boundary in
     the Kamchatka region. Analysis of the composition of the diatom flora makes
     possible a paleogeographic reconstruction of the shelf region in the western
     Bering Sea during the latest Pliocene and early Pleistocene.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: To show the diatom assemblages from the Pliocene-Pleistocene boundary beds in Kamchatka, Russia

Status: Complete

Maintenance frequency: None Planned
